> "Lord Vorpal"said the male while he followed Maurader"We' re
> leaving a explosive gift to our enemies while we are heading to
> reach or next goal"

Vorpal paused for a long moment, the sound of some metal on metal scratching could be heard in the background, "Of course." Vorpal replied, his voice silky smooth and controlled, "Let me know when you have obtained your . . . goal." The line closed without waiting for a reply.

(TAG: Darkfate)

Meanwhile in front of Darkfate, still in starfighter mode Marauder continued on his way, apparently oblivious to the fact that Darkfate is having to carry Nightstrike all this way. 

(TAG: Darkfate)

Preston



--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups. com, "supercyclonus" <supercyclonus@ ...> 
wrote:
>
> > "I'm running for Nightstrike' s and mine life" said Darkfate 
while he 
> > continued running
> 
> "What?" Vorpal's voice a maixture of anger and bafflement. "Malik 
> couldn't have defeated that quickly? Why isn't he answering his 
radio?"
> 
> (TAG: Darkfate)
> 
> Even as Vorpral was expressing his ire and confusion over the 
radio, 
> the tunnel that the minions were traveling through suddenly burst 
into 
> bright open skies as it suddenly ended!
> 
> Malik . . . or that is MARAUDER, as he renamed himself - roared out 
of 
> the exit, the grinding of gears distinctive as he shifted into his 
> starfighter mode! 
> 
> The tunnel they had been moving down emptied out several hundered 
feet 
> above a icey blue lake. Water crashed around the tunnel exit from 
> somewhere above, and fell majestically down to the water below. 
> 
> The air here smelled crisp and clean as small breezes rippled along 
the 
> waters. Trees and unspoiled wildlife lay in all directions. A few 
birds 
> sprang up with the unexpected intrusion of the Minions, skwaked and 
> moved away from them. 
> 
> It is obvious that the minions have exited somewhere a good 
distance 
> away from the great battle that had taken place near the Ark. There 
was 
> no hint of battle here, and mount St Hillary was now a mere spike 
in 
> the distance rather then the intimdating mount that she was!
> 
> (TAG: Darkfate)
> 
> Preston
>
